content.description: This has the same start and finish as “Entrance”, the crux is probably the start or moving back right to get to the shared top-out. This route is a little more fun than “entrance” and if you set up pads it is definitely worth doing.
content.protection: Pads + Pads + Pads, check the top out
content.location: Start with both hands on the vertical rail, from there move straight up and to the right. From the crimp start moving left and land at the flake/jug/pocket. Top out is directly above you And pretty straight forward.

content.description: This would make for a fun harder sit start, but the lower wall has a few small pockets that make for tricky feat as you move up, the start is a little tricky but figuring out how to gain the left hand pocket/jug is the end of hard climbing probably v1 from the ledge to the top.
content.location: The start is pictured but there are two small pockets, one for each hand! From the pockets find bad feet and work your way up to the jug/pocket, gain the ledge and top out the face above the ledge (tons of big pockets).

content.description: Start with both hands on the vertical rail, and layback hard. The crux is in the first 3 moves making this a confidence building Highball. The pocket is definitely in play. Top out straight up the face for coolness, or wimp out and go right on the ramp.Fun warmup problem, I wish i spent more time cleaning it because that would have made the boulder a lot more fun.
content.protection: Pads, and friends. Or extra pads.
content.location: Start on the vertical rail with both hands. And decide if you want to reach for another vertical rail above, or go for the pocket way right. This is the first boulder in Backdoor

content.description: This area provides morning shade, and the rocks stay cool until early afternoon. The name of this area comes from the back approach option from the Big Dig (afternoon shade). This rock had tons of moss on the holds and might need a quick brush off if it doesn’t see very much traffic. This area has a 35 min approach from the parking lot.
